data.text: Forests
Forests are an important natural resource.
Pakistan does not have great forest resources.
Forest coverage is also reduced due to cutting down trees and grazing animals.
Alpine forests
Alpine forests are mostly found in Chitral, Dir, Swat, and Gilgit.
Coniferous forests
Fir, spruce, deodar, and kail are some of the trees found in coniferous forests.
Dry forests.
Thorn or Rakh forests
Hardwood trees like acacia (kikar) and tamarisk are found in rakh forests.
Mangrove forests are found along the coast in southern Pakistan and the delta area of the Indus.
Mangroves protect the coastal region from erosion, tidal waves, and tsunamis.
Riverine or Bela forests
Babul and shisham are two types of trees found in the riverine forests.
Plantations are man-made forests. These are started in areas where there is enough water.
Eucalyptus, shisham, and babul trees are commonly grown on plantations.
Importance of forests
Green plants make oxygen which humans and animals need to breathe to stay alive.
Trees provide us with flowers, fruits, nuts, leaves, and wood.
Wood from trees and plants is used to make furniture, medicines, perfumes, paints, and resins.
